member.name: T:WindowsDisplayAPI.Device
member.summary: Represents a Windows Video Device including Display Devices and Video Controllers

member.name: M:WindowsDisplayAPI.Device.#ctor(System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Creates a new Device

member.name: P:WindowsDisplayAPI.Device.DeviceKey
member.summary: Gets the registry address of the device driver and configuration

member.name: P:WindowsDisplayAPI.Device.DeviceName
member.summary: Gets the Windows device name

member.name: P:WindowsDisplayAPI.Device.DevicePath
member.summary: Gets the Windows device path

member.name: M:WindowsDisplayAPI.Device.OpenDeviceKey
member.summary: Opens the registry key at the address specified by the DeviceKey property
member.returns: A RegistryKey instance for successful call, otherwise null
member.exception: Registry address is invalid or unknown.

member.name: M:WindowsDisplayAPI.Device.OpenDevicePnPKey
member.summary: Opens the registry key of the Windows PnP manager for this device
member.returns: A RegistryKey instance for successful call, otherwise null

member.name: T:WindowsDisplayAPI.Display
member.summary: Represents a Windows Attached Display Device

member.name: M:WindowsDisplayAPI.Display.#ctor(WindowsDisplayAPI.DisplayDevice)
member.summary: Creates a new Display
member.param: The DisplayDevice instance to copy information from

member.name: P:WindowsDisplayAPI.Display.CurrentSetting
member.summary: Gets a DisplaySetting object representing the display current settings

member.name: P:WindowsDisplayAPI.Display.IsGDIPrimary
member.summary: Gets a boolean value indicating if this display device is the Windows GDI primary device

member.name: P:WindowsDisplayAPI.Display.SavedSetting
member.summary: Gets a DisplaySettings object representing this display saved settings

member.name: M:WindowsDisplayAPI.Display.GetDisplays
member.summary: Returns a list of all attached displays on this machine
member.returns: An enumerable list of Displays

member.name: M:WindowsDisplayAPI.Display.Disable(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Disables and detaches this display device
member.param: Indicating if the changes should be applied immediately, recommended value is false

member.name: M:WindowsDisplayAPI.Display.GetScreen
member.summary: Returns the corresponding Screen instance for this display device
member.returns: A Screen object

member.name: M:WindowsDisplayAPI.Display.SetSettings(WindowsDisplayAPI.DisplaySetting,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Changes the display device settings to a new DisplaySettings object
member.param: The display settings that should be applied
Indicating if the changes should be applied immediately, recommended value is false

member.name: M:WindowsDisplayAPI.Display.ToUnAttachedDisplay
member.summary: Returns the corresponding UnAttachedDisplay device for this display. Only valid when this instance is invalidated due to display detachment.

member.summary: Sets the display boot persistence for the target display device

member.name: P:WindowsDisplayAPI.DisplayConfig.PathDisplayTarget.ConnectorInstance
member.summary: Gets the one-based instance number of this particular target only when the adapter has multiple targets of this type. The connector instance is a consecutive one-based number that is unique within each adapter. If this is the only target of this type on the adapter, this value is zero.
member.exception: Error code can be retrieved from Win32Exception.NativeErrorCode property

member.name: P:WindowsDisplayAPI.DisplayConfig.PathDisplayTarget.DevicePath
member.summary: Gets the display device path
member.exception: Error code can be retrieved from Win32Exception.NativeErrorCode property

member.name: P:WindowsDisplayAPI.DisplayConfig.PathDisplayTarget.EDIDManufactureCode
member.summary: Gets the display manufacture 3 character code from the display EDID manufacture identification
member.exception: Error code can be retrieved from Win32Exception.NativeErrorCode property
The EDID information does not contain this value

member.name: P:WindowsDisplayAPI.DisplayConfig.PathDisplayTarget.EDIDManufactureId
member.summary: Gets the display manufacture identification from the display EDID information
member.exception: Error code can be retrieved from Win32Exception.NativeErrorCode property
The EDID information does not contain this value

member.name: P:WindowsDisplayAPI.DisplayConfig.PathDisplayTarget.EDIDProductCode
member.summary: Gets the display product identification from the display EDID information
member.exception: Error code can be retrieved from Win32Exception.NativeErrorCode property
The EDID information does not contain this value

member.summary: Gets the display friendly name from the display EDID information

member.summary: Gets a boolean value indicating the device availability

member.summary: Gets the display device preferred signal information

member.summary: Gets a boolean value indicating if this path is the primary GDI path

member.summary: Gets a boolean value indicating if the source is in use by at least one active path

member.summary: Gets a boolean value indicating if the source mode information is available

member.name: P:WindowsDisplayAPI.DisplayConfig.PathInfo.PixelFormat
member.summary: Gets the specifies the pixel format of the source mode

member.name: P:WindowsDisplayAPI.DisplayConfig.PathInfo.Position
member.summary: Gets the position in the desktop coordinate space of the upper-left corner of this source surface. The source surface that is located at (0, 0) is always the primary source surface.

member.summary: Gets the size of the source mode

true to save the paths to the persistence database if call succeed, otherwise false
true to force driver mode enumeration before applying the paths

member.name: T:WindowsDisplayAPI.DisplayConfig.PathTargetDesktopImage
member.summary: Contains information about the target desktop image

member.name: M:WindowsDisplayAPI.DisplayConfig.PathTargetDesktopImage.#ctor(System.Drawing.Size,System.Drawing.Rectangle,System.Drawing.Rectangle)
member.summary: Creates a new PathTargetDesktopImage
member.param: Size of the VidPn source surface that is being displayed on the monitor
Where the desktop image will be positioned within monitor surface size. Region must be completely inside the bounds of the monitor surface size.
Which part of the desktop image for this clone group will be displayed on this path. This currently must be set to the desktop size.

member.name: P:WindowsDisplayAPI.DisplayConfig.PathTargetDesktopImage.ImageClip
member.summary: Gets part of the desktop image for this clone group that will be displayed on this path. This currently must be set to the desktop size.

member.name: P:WindowsDisplayAPI.DisplayConfig.PathTargetDesktopImage.ImageRegion
member.summary: Gets the part that the desktop image will be positioned within monitor surface size. Region must be completely inside the bounds of the monitor surface size.

member.name: P:WindowsDisplayAPI.DisplayConfig.PathTargetDesktopImage.MonitorSurfaceSize
member.summary: Gets the size of the VidPn source surface that is being displayed on the monitor

member.name: M:WindowsDisplayAPI.DisplayConfig.PathTargetDesktopImage.op_Equality(WindowsDisplayAPI.DisplayConfig.PathTargetDesktopImage,WindowsDisplayAPI.DisplayConfig.PathTargetDesktopImage)
member.summary: Checks for equality of two PathTargetDesktopImage instances
member.returns: true if both instances are equal, otherwise false

member.summary: Checks for inequality of two PathTargetDesktopImage instances
member.returns: true if both instances are not equal, otherwise false

member.name: M:WindowsDisplayAPI.DisplayConfig.PathTargetSignalInfo.#ctor(System.Drawing.Size,System.Drawing.Size,System.UInt64,WindowsDisplayAPI.Native.DisplayConfig.DisplayConfigScanLineOrdering,WindowsDisplayAPI.Native.DisplayConfig.VideoSignalStandard,System.UInt16)
member.summary: Creates a new PathTargetSignalInfo
member.param: Specifies the width and height (in pixels) of the active portion of the video signal.
Specifies the width and height (in pixels) of the entire video signal.
The scan-line ordering (for example, progressive or interlaced) of the video signal.
The video standard (if any) that defines the video signal. Supported by WDDM 1.3 and later display mini-port drivers running on Windows 8.1 and later.

The ratio of the VSync rate of a monitor that displays through a Miracast connected session to the VSync rate of the Miracast sink. The ratio of the VSync rate of a monitor that displays through a Miracast connected session to the VSync rate of the Miracast sink. Supported by WDDM 1.3 and later display mini-port drivers running on Windows 8.1 and later.

member.summary: Gets the horizontal synchronization frequency

member.name: P:WindowsDisplayAPI.DisplayConfig.PathTargetSignalInfo.ScanLineOrdering
member.summary: Gets the scan-line ordering (for example, progressive or interlaced) of the video signal

member.name: P:WindowsDisplayAPI.DisplayConfig.PathTargetSignalInfo.TotalSize
member.summary: Gets the width and height (in pixels) of the entire video signal

member.name: P:WindowsDisplayAPI.DisplayConfig.PathTargetSignalInfo.VerticalSyncFrequencyDivider
member.summary: Gets the ratio of the VSync rate of a monitor that displays through a Miracast connected session to the VSync rate of the Miracast sink. The ratio of the VSync rate of a monitor that displays through a Miracast connected session to the VSync rate of the Miracast sink. Supported by WDDM 1.3 and later display mini-port drivers running on Windows 8.1 and later

member.name: P:WindowsDisplayAPI.DisplayConfig.PathTargetSignalInfo.VerticalSyncFrequencyInMillihertz
member.summary: Gets the vertical synchronization frequency

member.name: P:WindowsDisplayAPI.DisplayConfig.PathTargetSignalInfo.VideoStandard
member.summary: Gets the video standard (if any) that defines the video signal. Supported by WDDM 1.3 and later display mini-port drivers running on Windows 8.1 and later

member.summary: Rotation mode is not specified

member.name: F:WindowsDisplayAPI.Native.DisplayConfig.DisplayConfigRotation.Identity
member.summary: Indicates that rotation is 0 degreeslandscape mode.

member.name: F:WindowsDisplayAPI.Native.DisplayConfig.DisplayConfigRotation.Rotate90
member.summary: Indicates that rotation is 90 degrees clockwiseportrait mode.

member.name: F:WindowsDisplayAPI.Native.DisplayConfig.DisplayConfigRotation.Rotate180
member.summary: Indicates that rotation is 180 degrees clockwiseinverted landscape mode.

member.name: F:WindowsDisplayAPI.Native.DisplayConfig.DisplayConfigRotation.Rotate270
member.summary: Indicates that rotation is 270 degrees clockwiseinverted portrait mode.

member.name: T:WindowsDisplayAPI.Native.DisplayConfig.DisplayConfigScaling
member.summary: Scaling modes https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/windows/hardware/ff553974(v=vs.85).aspx

member.name: F:WindowsDisplayAPI.Native.DisplayConfig.DisplayConfigScaling.NotSpecified
member.summary: Scaling mode is not specified

member.name: F:WindowsDisplayAPI.Native.DisplayConfig.DisplayConfigScaling.Identity
member.summary: Indicates the identity transformation; the source content is presented with no change. This transformation is available only if the path's source mode has the same spatial resolution as the path's target mode.

member.name: F:WindowsDisplayAPI.Native.DisplayConfig.DisplayConfigScaling.Centered
member.summary: Indicates the centering transformation; the source content is presented unscaled, centered with respect to the spatial resolution of the target mode.

member.name: F:WindowsDisplayAPI.Native.DisplayConfig.DisplayConfigScaling.Stretched
member.summary: Indicates the content is scaled to fit the path's target.

member.name: F:WindowsDisplayAPI.Native.DisplayConfig.DisplayConfigScaling.AspectRatioCenteredMax
member.summary: Indicates the aspect-ratio centering transformation.

member.name: F:WindowsDisplayAPI.Native.DisplayConfig.DisplayConfigScaling.Custom
member.summary: Indicates that the caller requests a custom scaling that the caller cannot describe with any of the other values. Only a hardware vendor's value-add application should use this value, because the value-add application might require a private interface to the driver. The application can then use this value to indicate additional context for the driver for the custom value on the specified path.

member.name: F:WindowsDisplayAPI.Native.DisplayConfig.DisplayConfigScaling.Preferred
member.summary: Indicates that the caller does not have any preference for the scaling.

member.name: T:WindowsDisplayAPI.Native.DisplayConfig.DisplayConfigScanLineOrdering
member.summary: Possible values for display scan line ordering https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/windows/hardware/ff553977(v=vs.85).aspx

member.name: F:WindowsDisplayAPI.Native.DisplayConfig.DisplayConfigScanLineOrdering.NotSpecified
member.summary: Indicates that scan-line ordering of the output is unspecified.

member.name: F:WindowsDisplayAPI.Native.DisplayConfig.DisplayConfigScanLineOrdering.Progressive
member.summary: Indicates that the output is a progressive image.

member.name: F:WindowsDisplayAPI.Native.DisplayConfig.DisplayConfigScanLineOrdering.InterlacedWithUpperFieldFirst
member.summary: Indicates that the output is an interlaced image that is created beginning with the upper field.

member.name: F:WindowsDisplayAPI.Native.DisplayConfig.DisplayConfigScanLineOrdering.InterlacedWithLowerFieldFirst
member.summary: Indicates that the output is an interlaced image that is created beginning with the lower field.

member.summary: Indicates a connector that is not one of the types that is indicated by the following enumerators in this enumeration.

member.summary: Indicates an HD15 (VGA) connector.

member.name: F:WindowsDisplayAPI.Native.DisplayConfig.DisplayConfigVideoOutputTechnology.SVideo
member.summary: Indicates an S-video connector.

member.name: F:WindowsDisplayAPI.Native.DisplayConfig.DisplayConfigVideoOutputTechnology.CompositeVideo
member.summary: Indicates a composite video connector group.

member.name: F:WindowsDisplayAPI.Native.DisplayConfig.DisplayConfigVideoOutputTechnology.ComponentVideo
member.summary: Indicates a component video connector group.

member.name: F:WindowsDisplayAPI.Native.DisplayConfig.DisplayConfigVideoOutputTechnology.DVI
member.summary: Indicates a Digital Video Interface (DVI) connector.

member.name: F:WindowsDisplayAPI.Native.DisplayConfig.DisplayConfigVideoOutputTechnology.HDMI
member.summary: Indicates a High-Definition Multimedia Interface (HDMI) connector.

member.name: F:WindowsDisplayAPI.Native.DisplayConfig.DisplayConfigVideoOutputTechnology.LVDS
member.summary: Indicates a Low Voltage Differential Swing (LVDS) connector.

member.name: F:WindowsDisplayAPI.Native.DisplayConfig.DisplayConfigVideoOutputTechnology.DJPN
member.summary: Indicates a Japanese D connector.

member.name: F:WindowsDisplayAPI.Native.DisplayConfig.DisplayConfigVideoOutputTechnology.SDI
member.summary: Indicates an SDI connector.

member.name: F:WindowsDisplayAPI.Native.DisplayConfig.DisplayConfigVideoOutputTechnology.DisplayPortExternal
member.summary: Indicates an external display port, which is a display port that connects externally to a display device.

member.name: F:WindowsDisplayAPI.Native.DisplayConfig.DisplayConfigVideoOutputTechnology.DisplayPortEmbedded
member.summary: Indicates an embedded display port that connects internally to a display device.

member.name: F:WindowsDisplayAPI.Native.DisplayConfig.DisplayConfigVideoOutputTechnology.UDIExternal
member.summary: Indicates an external Unified Display Interface (UDI), which is a UDI that connects externally to a display device.

member.name: F:WindowsDisplayAPI.Native.DisplayConfig.DisplayConfigVideoOutputTechnology.UDIEmbedded
member.summary: Indicates an embedded UDI that connects internally to a display device.

member.name: F:WindowsDisplayAPI.Native.DisplayConfig.DisplayConfigVideoOutputTechnology.SDTVDongle
member.summary: Indicates a dongle cable that supports standard definition television (SDTV).

member.name: F:WindowsDisplayAPI.Native.DisplayConfig.DisplayConfigVideoOutputTechnology.Miracast
member.summary: Indicates that the VidPN target is a Miracast wireless display device.

member.name: F:WindowsDisplayAPI.Native.DisplayConfig.DisplayConfigVideoOutputTechnology.Internal
member.summary: Indicates that the video output device connects internally to a display device (for example, the internal connection in a laptop computer).

member.name: T:WindowsDisplayAPI.UnAttachedDisplay
member.summary: Represents a Windows UnAttached Display Device

member.summary: Creates a new UnAttachedDisplay
member.param: The DisplayDevice instance to copy information from

member.name: M:WindowsDisplayAPI.UnAttachedDisplay.GetUnAttachedDisplays
member.summary: Returns a list of all unattached displays on this machine
member.returns: An enumerable list of UnAttachedDisplay

member.name: M:WindowsDisplayAPI.UnAttachedDisplay.Enable(WindowsDisplayAPI.DisplaySetting,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Enables this unattached display device
member.param: The display settings that should be applied while enabling the display device
Indicating if the changes should be applied immediately, recommended value is false

member.name: M:WindowsDisplayAPI.UnAttachedDisplay.ToDisplay
member.summary: Returns the corresponding Display device for this unattached display. Only functions when this instance is invalidated due to display attachment.
